item.title: Danita add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Danita add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Danita add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Danita add a quote by John Quincy Adams
item.description: "Thus situated, the perilous experiment must be made. Let me make it with full deliberations, and be prepared for the consequences." -- John Quincy Adams

item.title: Danita add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Danita add a quote by Ernesto Che Guevara
item.description: "There are no boundaries in this struggle to the death. We cannot be indifferent to what happens anywhere in the world, for a victory by any country over imperialism is our victory; just as any country's defeat is a defeat for all of us." -- Ernesto Che Guevara

item.title: Danita add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "If I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Danita add a quote by Carter G. Woodson
item.description: "At this moment, then, the Negroes must begin to do the very thing which they have been taught that they cannot do." -- Carter G. Woodson

item.title: Danita add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Danita add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "The paradox of education is precisely this - that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated. " -- James Baldwin
